title: Case Insensitive Cast
content: PHP's cast operators are case-insensitive, meaning variations like ``(int)``, ``(INT)``, and ``(iNt)`` all work the same way. However, the common convention is to use all lowercase, such as ``(int)``. Using other case styles is technically valid but extremely rare and generally discouraged for consistency and readability in code. Stick to lowercase for better code standards.
